author: @ktvf11
title: Military Report: Russia and China press tensions in the Pacific impact the U.S. and treaty allies
text: Military Report: Russia and China press tensions in the Pacific impact the U.S. and treaty allies Conflicts and incursions are intensifying for Alaska, Japan and the Philippines FAIRBANKS, Alaska (KTVF) - As Russian aircraft continue to enter the air defense identification zone (ADIZ) near Alaska, 2024 appears to be on track to surpass the number of detected flights that occurred in 2023. As Russia and China continue to conduct exercises and other military operations, they have increased their presence and sometimes tactics in the Pacific. Those incursions and tactics are now creating increased concern for leadership in Alaska, Japan and the Philippines. The later two being treaty defense partners of the U.S. [Just days after defense forces were sent to Western Alaska](https://www.webcenterfairbanks.com/2024/09/19/us-troops-finish-deployment-remote-alaska-island-amid-spike-russian-military-activity/) in response to Russian incursions, four more Russian planes were detected off the coast of Alaska on Monday. It is unclear what kind of planes were detected but the Russian aircraft did not cross into U.S. airspace. While these aircraft were “not seen as a threat” this marks the fifth time in the month of Sept. that Russian aircraft came near U.S. airspace. Two weeks ago, the U.S. military sent over 100 troops to the Aleutian Islands as well as a Coast Guard and naval vessel. The deployment of those units came as a response to incursions near Alaska, including Russian vessels entering Alaska’s exclusive economic zone or EEZ. That incident also involved aircraft being intercepted as well. Despite the heightened response to activity, the Pentagon echoed the statements of the North American Aerospace Defense Command (NORAD) and said that the activity was not seen as a threat. While those forces have returned to base, another incident occurred on Sep. 24. In response to the previous incident involving the deployment of defense forces, Alaska’s delegation expressed greater concern than the Pentagon.[ “Authoritarian regimes are testing the United States,”](https://www.webcenterfairbanks.com/2024/09/18/100-soldiers-deployed-aleutian-chain-amid-increasing-russian-chinese-activity-near-alaska/) said Sen. Dan Sullivan, the junior senator for Alaska. According to NORAD, there are usually six or seven incidents of this kind in a given year. There have been over 50 of these incidents in the last two years combined however. In 2023 there were a total of 26 detections and so far there have been 25 this year. That also means 2024 is likely to see an even higher number of adversary aircraft detections compared to 2023. The increase comes at a time when Russian and U.S. relations are more tense as a result of the war in Ukraine which began in Feb. of 2022. Those incidents have at times included Chinese forces which have also raised concerns for the both U.S. and our allies. Japan faced similar intrusions on Monday as well as a Russian spy plane entered Japanese airspace. This led to Japanese fighter jets being scrambled to intercept the Russian aircraft. Those jets had to use flares for the first time to ward off the Russian aircraft as it did not respond to verbal communications. The incident in Japan is just one of many that reflect activity seen near Alaska and the growing number if incidents in the area has led Tokyo to increase military investments. That activity is also of concern to the U.S. as there are multiple U.S. military bases in Japan with whom we have a defense treaty. Another defense treaty partner that hosts U.S. military assets is the Philippines. They have also have had multiple incidents with Chinese vessels as territorial disputes in the South China Sea. Those incidents have been described as physical conflicts that come just short of being warfare tactics. According to the U.S. Dept. of State, the most recent incident between these two nations in the month of Aug. The situation involved a Chinese Coast Guard vessel deliberately colliding with a Filipino Coast Guard vessel three times in the Philippines EEZ. Incidents such as this one have also occurred with U.S. personnel on board Filipino vessels. If these incidents escalate to included an armed attack, it could invoke article four of a 1951 defense treaty between the Philippines and the U.S. which could mean American involvement in the conflict. While it remains unlikely that war will break out in the region, Alaska’s strategic position in the has been getting more attention from Washington D.C. amidst the rising tensions. [Download the Newscenter Fairbanks apps today and stay informed with the latest news and weather alerts.](https://www.webcenterfairbanks.com/page/streaming-interior-alaskas-most-trusted-news-sports-weather-and-more-for-free/) Copyright 2024 KTVF. title: 宜兴紫砂壶、景德镇玲珑茶具 京东618父亲节茶具好礼清单来了！_中华网
text:
随着父亲节临近，挑选一份称心如意的礼物成为子女们表达孝心的重要方式。京东数据显示，近日钛杯搜索量同比增长3.6倍，成为父亲节的热门礼赠选择。为了更好地满足消费者需求，京东618联合飞剑、吨吨、格沵、TILIVING钛立维等品牌，带来众多精选钛杯以及茶具套装，并提供低价5折、跨店每满200减30、礼赠专享85折等优惠。正值京东家居馆线下首店在京东Mall北京双井店开业期间，店内还推出采销推荐茶具低至8折的福利。
随着健康生活理念的深入人心，钛杯以其天然的抗菌特性和卓越的材质安全性，正成为现代人健康饮水的品质之选。飞剑纯钛保温杯创新采用晶钻科技，双层真空结构实现长效保温保冷效果，轻巧杯身方便爸爸随身携带，尽享健康饮水体验，父亲节直降330元。吨吨纯钛保温杯采用超99%高纯度钛打造，保温保鲜性更好，浮雕纹饰搭配细腻哑光工艺，尽显低调奢华，父亲节低至6.5折。格沵纯钛保温泡茶杯精选航空级纯钛材质，其天然抑菌特性确保饮品持久保鲜，创新茶水分离设计，让茶汤浓度随心掌控，饮用更安心，父亲节低至7.5折。此外，还有到手价5折的艾曼格纯钛保温杯、恩尔美纯钛保温杯等更多品质钛杯，均是礼赠父亲节的佳选。
对于钟爱茶道的父亲，京东厨具特别臻选多款不同材质、风格的精品茶具。其中，百年利永出品的宜兴紫砂景舟石瓢壶，以顾景舟大师创作的唐云石瓢为原型，经过精心改良，在保留传统韵味的同时更符合现代饮茶需求，精选原矿底槽青泥料，质地细腻纯净，经传统工艺烧制后呈现出紫砂特有的古朴质感。这款紫砂壶原价2600元，父亲节到手价仅1950元。景德镇青花玲珑茶具以传统镂雕工艺打造晶莹剔透的玲珑纹饰，青花典雅与玲珑灵动相得益彰，堪称茶具艺术精品，京东价698元，父亲节到手价598元。TILIVING钛立维纯钛功夫茶具套装创新融合传统茶道与现代科技，采用纯钛材质打造，兼具古典韵味与现代实用性，抑菌保鲜，泡茶不坏茶，原价1588元，父亲节特惠价仅需1018元。
值得关注的是，京东MALL北京双井店将于6月14日盛大开业，也为消费者甄选又好又便宜的茶具好物，助力父爱表达。比如，京东茶具采销力荐的苏氏陶瓷千里江山侧把功夫茶具，将传世名画与现代工艺完美融合，防烫侧把和壶嘴过滤一体设计，气质出众又实用。目前，这款茶具正在线上线下同步售卖中，开业钜惠低至8折，PLUS到手价仅239元。
以礼传情，感恩父爱。京东618正在火热进行中，消费者可通过京东APP搜索“茶酒咖具618”进入专属会场，精选各式茶具、酒具、咖啡具，搜索“厨具618”，还能选购钛杯、品质锅具以及餐具等，全场低至5折，以旧换钛厨具最高立减100元。赶快去挑选父亲节好礼，让你的心意成为父亲日常生活中最贴心的陪伴吧！
免责声明：市场有风险，选择需谨慎！此文仅供参考，不作买卖依据。

author: TalCual
title: Guanipa: "Deportar a un militar perseguido es una puñalada por la espalda" - TalCual
text: Guanipa: «Deportar a un militar perseguido es una puñalada por la espalda» Juan Pablo Guanipa, dirigente de PJ, cuestionó la deportación de EEUU del teniente Pedro Naranjo, exigió se respete el derecho al asilo, también que la comunidad internacional vele por el cumplimiento de los acuerdos firmados en Barbados entre el gobierno y la oposición El dirigente del partido Primero Justicia (PJ) Juan Pablo Guanipa cuestionó la decisión de los Estados Unidos (EEUU) de deportar al teniente Pedro Naranjo Maldonado, y exigió a la comunidad internacional presionar para que el gobierno de Nicolás Maduro cumpla con los acuerdos firmados en Barbados. «¿Cómo es posible que la administración (Joe) Biden haya permitido que este militar venezolano (Pedro Naranjo) sea expuesto a tortura y tratos crueles al deportarlo. Eso es sencillamente inaceptable. Es una puñalada por la espalda a nuestros esfuerzos para liberar a Venezuela«, sentenció a través de un video publicado este 28 de diciembre en su [cuenta en X](https://twitter.com/JuanPGuanipa/status/1740389588802142671?s=20) (antes Twitter). «Exigimos que se respete el derecho al asilo a quienes huyen de la persecución», dijo. [Pedro Naranjo](https://talcualdigital.com/el-teniente-pedro-naranjo-esta-preso-en-ramo-verde-luego-de-que-eeuu-lo-deportara/) huyó de Venezuela junto con su padre, el general de división Pedro José Naranjo Suárez, prisionero político durante tres años y medio. El pasado 14 de diciembre fue deportado y entregado a las autoridades venezolanas. Actualmente está detenido en el Centro Nacional de Procesados Militares de Ramo Verde. Guanipa, quien también denunció la situación actual de varios presos políticos, señaló que mientras siga habiendo presos políticos en las cárceles «el régimen seguirá incumpliendo los acuerdos de Barbados». El pasado 17 de octubre el gobierno de Nicolás Maduro y la Plataforma Unitaria de la oposición firmaron en Barbados dos acuerdos parciales, uno sobre «la promoción de derechos políticos y garantías electorales para todos» y otro sobre «la protección para los intereses vitales de la nación». [*Lea también: En Claves | Inhabilitaciones y sanciones: ¿dentro o fuera de los acuerdos de Barbados?](https://talcualdigital.com/en-claves-inhabilitaciones-y-sanciones-dentro-o-fuera-de-los-acuerdos-de-barbados/) «Exigimos que la comunidad internacional se pronuncie y sean garantes de la palabra empeñada de la dictadura», fustigó. Casos García Palomo y Hernández Da Costa El dirigente político informó que los detenidos en Ramo Verde están siendo víctimas de abusos y detalló atropellos contra el coronel Oswaldo García Palomo y el general Héctor Hernández Da Costa. «Nuestros presos políticos están sufriendo una nueva arremetida de la dictadura. Los esbirros de (Nicolás) Maduro han robado las pertenencias de los presos de consciencia detenidos en la Dgcim (Dirección General de Contrainteligencia Militar). Les confiscaron alimentos, libros, medicinas y fotos», narró. Recordó que el García Palomo sigue en «confinamiento solitario», también que a Da Costa « [le quitaron](https://talcualdigital.com/al-preso-politico-hector-hernandez-da-costa-le-quitaron-la-medicacion-en-el-dgcim/) su glucómetro (artefacto para la diabetes), medicinas y otros objetos personales». «El general (Da Costa) sufre de graves problemas de salud producto de su largo cautiverio», acotó. [García Palomo](https://talcualdigital.com/quien-es-el-coronel-oswaldo-garcia-palomo/) está detenido por su supuesta participación en la llamada Operación Armagedón y Hernández Da Costa está detenido por supuestamente estar involucrado en el presunto ataque contra Nicolás Maduro, en 2018.

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Dolly Parton’s Hometown Holds an Annual Singing Competition in Her Honor: Here’s How to Enter
text:
By Clayton Edwards ,
7 hours ago Dolly Parton was born and raised in Sevierville, Tennessee. Today the thriving tourist stop has plenty to offer travelers and locals alike. Visitors will find a long list of restaurants, lodging, and attractions. Sevierville even celebrates its most famous resident with a bronze statue. They also hold an annual singing competition in her honor. The Mountain Soul Vocal Competition is one-of-a-kind, just like the iconic artist it celebrates.
The 20th annual Mountain Soul Vocal Competition will take place this year in Sevierville. Competitors will select one of the 3,000 songs Parton has penned to sing in their unique style. “Songwriting and storytelling are an integral part of Smoky Mountain culture and no one does it better than Doll,” said Sevierville Chamber of Commerce Director of Marketing and Communications Amanda Marr. “Dolly’s catalog of music is impressive and so versatile across all genres. This competition encourages vocalists to delve into their music and create a memorable performance,” she added.
How to Enter the Dolly Parton-Themed Vocal Competition Those who want to compete in the Mountain Soul Vocal Competition still have time to enter. The deadline for entries is April 12. Those who want to audition can send their videos to BloominBBQ.com where they can also find the official rules.
Only 30 finalists will be selected to perform during the contest which will be part of the Bloomin’ BBQ Music & Food Festival on May 18 in downtown Sevierville. Ten hopefuls will be selected in the 12 and under category. Judges will select 20 finalists from the 13 and up category.
Those who wish to audition should keep in mind that the Mountain Soul Vocal Competition honors Parton’s talent and individuality. As a result, it isn’t an impersonation competition. According to a press release, “It is not necessary, nor is it encouraged, to impersonate Dolly Parton, either physically or vocally during the competition.”
Dollymania.net hosts a comprehensive list of the songs Parton has written. All of those songs are eligible for use in the competition. Contestants may submit up to two songs per entry.
Prizes include guitars autographed by Parton, a recording session in Nashville, Dollywood passes, and cash.
Featured Image by Sam Hodde/Getty Images for ABA
Expand All Read in NewsBreak

organizations.name: sevierville chamber of commerce director of marketing and communications

author: Katherine Ross
title: Judge sides with SEC in Terraform case on securities sales questionÂ
text: Judge sides with SEC in Terraform case on securities sales question The judgment represents an SEC victory ahead of a formal trial [Katherine Ross](/author/katherine-ross)/ Tada Images/Shutterstock modified by Blockworks Judge Jed Rakoff — the judge overseeing the US Securities and Exchange Commission’s case against Terraform Labs and former CEO Do Kwon — has granted a summary judgment in favor of the regulatory agency. The judgment asserts that both Kwon and Terraform offered and sold unregistered securities. The claim is focused on LUNA and MIR tokens. The SEC argued that Kwon and Terraform “offered and effected transactions in unregistered security-based swaps, and claims that defendants engaged in fraudulent schemes to lead investors astray.” Read more: [Where things stand: The SEC vs Do Kwon and Terraform Labs](https://blockworks.co/news/terraform-labs-do-kwon-sec-lawsuit) Rakoff wrote that he “grants summary judgment for the SEC on Count IV of the Amended Complaint, involving defendants’ unregistered offers and sales of LUNA and MIR in violation of Sections 5(a) and (5c) of the Securities Act.” “There is no genuine dispute that UST, LUNA, wLUNA, and MIR are securities because they are investment contracts,” Rakoff wrote. He further ruled that Howey’s definition of an investment contract is a “binding statement of the law.” Rakoff found that UST, wLUNA and the aforementioned LUNA and MIR are investment contracts under the Howey test. The trial will now focus on the fraud claims that the [SEC brought against Terraform and Kwon](https://blockworks.co/news/sec-charges-do-kwon-terraform-labs-with-fraud-misleading-investors). The SEC filed its charges in February. “Defendants make much of the fact, undisputed by the SEC, that UST on its own was not a security because purchasers understood that its value would remain stable at $1.00 rather than generate a profit,” Rakoff continued. “But, beginning in March 2021, holders of UST could deposit their tokens in the Anchor Protocol, which defendants’ efforts developed and which Kwon himself publicly announced would generate ‘by far the highest stablecoin yield in the market,’ with a ‘target’ of ‘20% fixed APR.” Rakoff said that Kwon’s “repeated statements” led investors to believe that they could make a profit due to the efforts of Terraform to develop its blockchain. The [SEC](https://blockworks.co/tag/sec) had asked for the [judge to grant a judgment](https://blockworks.co/news/sec-judge-oversee-terrform-ruling) on the securities claims to prevent them from being decided by a jury when the case ultimately proceeds to the courtroom. “We strongly disagree with the decision and do not believe that the UST stablecoin or the other tokens at issue are securities. Further, the SEC’s fraud claims are not supported by evidence, and we will continue to vigorously defend against those meritless allegations at trial,” a spokesperson for Terraform Labs told Blockworks via email. The filing confirms that jury selection is set to begin on Jan. 24, with the actual trial beginning Jan. 29. “Unlike the claims involving offering or selling unregistered securities or security-based swaps, which the Court has resolved as a matter of law, genuine disputes of material fact linger that preclude summary judgment for any party on the fraud claims,” Rakoff wrote. Additionally, the court denied a motion from the defendants to exclude two SEC experts, and a motion from the SEC to exclude one expert for the defense. Judge Rakoff did, however, grant the SEC’s motion to exclude two other defense experts: Raj Unny and Dr. Christine Parlour. Updated Dec. 29, 2023 at 9:25 am ET: Added comment from Terraform Labs. Don’t miss the next big story – join our [free daily newsletter](https://blockworks.co/newsletter?source=end).

author: REDACCIÓN BOLÍVAR
title: Gobernador de Bolívar sanciona ordenanza para honrar a víctimas del conflicto | EL UNIVERSAL - Cartagena
text: Fiel a su compromiso con la construcción de paz, el gobernador de Bolívar, Yamil Arana Padauí, sancionó el proyecto de ordenanza por medio del cual se institucionaliza la realización anual de actividades conmemorativas de las víctimas del conflicto armado en el marco de la reparación, el retorno y la paz. [Lea: Tinto entre Dumek, Yamil y Mintransporte le suma $124 mil millones a Transcaribe](https://www.eluniversal.com.co/politica/tinto-entre-dumek-yamil-y-mintransporte-le-suma-124-mil-millones-a-transcaribe-NB10444548) “La puesta en marcha de la ordenanza 368 es otra muestra del compromiso que tiene nuestro gobierno con las víctimas del departamento. Desde la unidad y la articulación, seguiremos trabajando por un futuro que valore la memoria; uno justo, donde la paz se vea materializada en los territorios”, aseguró el mandatario. [Lea: Gobierno Petro apoyará Transcaribe y terminación de vía Perimetral](https://www.eluniversal.com.co/cartagena/gobierno-petro-apoyara-transcaribe-y-terminacion-de-via-perimetral-OB10444183) La iniciativa, liderada por la Secretaría de Paz, Víctimas y Reconciliación, en cabeza del secretario Iván Sanes, busca honrar la memoria de aquellos afectados por décadas de violencia en el departamento. [Lea: Gobernador Arana se pronuncia tras accidente en el sur de Bolívar](https://www.eluniversal.com.co/regional/bolivar/gobernador-arana-se-pronuncia-tras-accidente-en-el-sur-de-bolivar-BG10431617) “En la memoria de nuestras víctimas fallecidas, y también por la vida de miles de víctimas resilientes, resuena la paz. Gracias gobernador por escuchar las voces de aquellos que hoy promueven la paz en los territorios”, expresó Sanes. Con la implementación de este proyecto, miembros de las comunidades de Capaca, El Salado, Macayepo, Las Palmas, La Pacha, Zipacoa, Las Pavas, CCCN Eladio Ariza, San José de Playón, Las Brisas, los corregimientos de El Carmen de Bolívar, Mango de La Púa 2, Santo Madero, San Blas (Simití) y el Consejo Comunitario de comunidades Negras Mamajarí del Níspero, a través de los comités de impulso, recibirán 16 salarios mínimos legales vigentes para la realización de las actividades conmemorativas. [Lea: Gobernación invierte más de $6 mil millones para revivir estadio Talaigua Nuevo](https://www.eluniversal.com.co/regional/gobernacion-invierte-mas-de-6-mil-millones-para-revivir-estadio-talaigua-nuevo-CH10428947)

author: Ruetir
title: Saudi Arabia forbade live broadcasts of tarawih prayers from the mosque
text:
loading…
Saudi Arabia forbids live broadcasts of tarawih prayers from the mosque for any media platform. Photo/Hani Alshaer/Anadolu Agency
RIYADH – The Saudi government has issued a new directive that prohibits the live broadcast of Tarawih Salat from the mosque for any media platform.
The ban was presented by the Ministry of Islamic Affairs, Preaching, and Guidance of Saudi Arabia, as published by the Government News; Saudi Press Agency (SPA) on Wednesday.
According to the ministry, the kingdom also banned the use of cameras in the mosque to record priests and worshipers during prayers, including tarawih evening prayers during Ramadan.
The ministry stated that these steps aim to maintain the sanctity of the mosque and maintain an appropriate atmosphere for worship, ensuring that pilgrims are not disturbed.
The ministry also emphasized the importance of priests and speakers to adhere to the ministry’s guidelines and guide the congregation to adhere to the right ethics in the mosque.
In addition, the ministry stressed that the collection of financial contributions to hold the iftar pilgrims at the mosque was not permitted.
If the iftar pilgrims are held, it must be held in the area specified under the supervision of the relevant authority, while ensuring compliance with health and safety steps.
Ramadan in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia is estimated to begin on February 27 to March 29, 2025.
(but)
(Tagstotranslate) Salaat Tarawih (T) Arab Saudi (T) Ramadan (T) Masjid (T) Mohammed Bin Salman

author: Gladys Rivadeneira
title: Cortes de luz en Guayaquil este viernes 13 de diciembre
text:
Los cortes de luz en Guayaquil este viernes 13 de diciembre de 2024 son de tres horas para el sector residencial.
La CNEL definió la programación para mañana.
Más noticias: Horarios de cortes de luz en Guayaquil este jueves 12 de diciembre Ecuador está a nueve días de que se cumpla la palabra del presidente Daniel Noboa de que ya no existirán cortes de luz luego del 20 de diciembre .
La suspensión del servicio de energía eléctrica en el país empezó, de forma programada, el 23 de septiembre.
La dependencia de las lluvias para la generación de energía eléctrica se convirtió en la principal causa de la crisis energética.
En este tiempo, el Gobierno de Daniel Noboa intentó reducir los cortes de luz. Sin embargo, la grave sequía se mantuvo.
Ecuador tuvo cortes de hasta 14 horas diarias, tras intentar reducir de 10 a ocho horas.
La mayor reducción se ha dado justamente en esta semana, con cortes de hasta tres horas .
El Gobierno anunció el fin de los apagones por varios factores.
El incremento de las lluvias mejoró el nivel de los caudales y embalses que abastecen a las hidroeléctricas en los últimos días.
Las inversiones emergentes en la reactivación o activación de proyectos energéticos emergentes.
Esto, con el fin de repotenciar del Sistema Nacional Interconectado o la diversificación de la matriz energética.
Además, el intercambio de energía a Colombia , luego de las negociaciones impulsadas por las autoridades.
Mientras el 20 de diciembre llega, los cortes de energía para esta semana, en Guayaquil y todo el país, continúan con hasta tres horas de duración para el sector residencial .
Mientras, en el sector industrial , los cortes también son de hasta tres horas de duración.
A continuación, los cortes de luz en Guayaquil este viernes 13 de diciembre de 2024 :

author: Brian Kerhin, FOX 11 News
title: chevron-right
text: APPLETON (WLUK) – The suspect in an Appleton murder, which [was apparently prompted by an argument in a food truck line](https://fox11online.com/newsletter-daily/elliot-campbell-elijah-dodson-fatal-shooting-murder-homicide-downtown-appleton-college-avenue-food-truck-line-fight), was ordered Thursday to stand trial. Elliot Campbell, 21, enters a plea Feb. 8 on the first-degree intentional homicide charge for the [Dec. 24 death of Elijah Dodson](https://fox11online.com/news/local/22-year-old-shot-in-the-100-block-of-s-walnut-st-appleton). After testimony from Appleton Police Sgt. Matthew Kuether at a preliminary hearing Thursday, Campbell was bound over for trial. According to one witness, the confrontation started in the line for a food truck just off College Avenue. One person walked up behind a group of people "so it looked like he cut in line." From there, it escalated into a fight, ending with the shots fired. One of the two men who joined the line gave police a similar explanation about what started the confrontation, although he did not see who fired the shots. Traffic camera video captured some video of the incident -- including showing what they believe be Campbell with a gun, and the fight, but not the shooting itself. The complaint does not include any comments from Campbell. Dodson died of two gunshot wounds to the head, according to the autopsy cited in the complaint.
